title: Giuliani, Trump Spoke Up To 10 Times a Day, Jan. 6 Panel Told
description: Rudy Giuliani was in daily contact with President Donald Trump between Nov. 5, 2020 and Jan. 15, 2021, as much as 10 times a day, according to testimony by former New York Police Commissioner Bernard Kerik.

title: Japan’s Kishida Says Election to Come Before Tax Hike for Defense
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said he expected the next general election to come before a possible hike in taxes that has met resistance from the public and is intended to fund his unprecedented expansion of defense spending.

title: US Weighs Covid-Prevention Measures for Travelers From China
description: The US is considering taking new Covid-19 precautions for people traveling from China, which has seen a rapid rise in infections as officials lift Covid Zero restrictions.

title: Brazil Scraps Plan to Extend Federal Tax Cuts on Fuel
description: A worker fuels a vehicle at a Petroleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobras) gas station in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on Friday, April 8, 2022. Brazil’s consumer prices surged past all forecasts in March following the national oil company’s decision to jack up fuel costs, adding to global inflationary pressures in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Photographer: Andre Borges/Bloomberg

title: Biden to Comply With High Court Order, Continue to Prep for Title 42 Lifting
description: The White House said it would comply with the Supreme Court’s order keeping in place sweeping, coronavirus border controls, but would continue to prepare for eventually being able to lift the restrictions.

title: Mnuchin Briefly Discussed 25th Amendment to Remove Trump, Jan. 6 Transcript Shows
description: Outgoing Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Secretary of State Michael Pompeo briefly discussed removing President Donald Trump through the 25th Amendment after the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack but rejected the idea, according to a transcript of Mnuchin’s testimony.

title: US Supreme Court Orders Title 42 Border Restrictions Kept in Effect
description: The US Supreme Court ordered pandemic-era border restrictions to remain in effect, granting a request by Republican state officials who said lifting the rules would have produced an unmanageable surge of migrants seeking to enter the country.

title: Trump’s Tax Returns Set to Be Released by House Panel on Friday
description: Donald Trump Photographer: Chris Kleponis/Polaris/Bloomberg

title: New York Raises Cap on Pensions’ Private Equity, Hedge Fund Assets
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul signed a bill on Friday that allows the state’s and New York City’s pensions to increase allocations to more expensive and opaque asset classes like private equity that could potentially deliver higher returns.

title: George Santos Made Up Much of His Resume But GOP’s McCarthy May Need His Vote
description: Newly elected congressman George Santos’s serial fabrications about his life story, including false claims of work at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Citigroup Inc., sets up a key test for Republican leader Kevin McCarthy, who’s struggling to win next week’s vote for House speaker.

title: What You Need to Know About Rising Serbia-Kosovo Tensions
description: Three decades after the bloody breakup of Yugoslavia, the ethnic hostilities that ignited the conflict linger on. Kosovo declared its independence from former Yugoslav republic Serbia in 2008, but Serbia refuses to let it go. Russia’s invasion of Ukraine added a new dimension to the standoff. And now, Serbia’s army has been ordered on high alert after weeks of rising tensions between authorities in Kosovo and the local Serb minority there.

title: Biden’s Offshore Wind Ambitions Face Another Setback
description: Wind turbines operate at the E.On AG Scroby Sands facility near Great Yarmouth, U.K.

title: Putin Bans Selling Russian Oil to Price Cap Participants
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin attends the 10th National Congress of Judges in Moscow on November 29, 2022. - *Editor's note : this image is distributed by Russian state owned agency Sputnik.* (Photo by Mikhail Metzel / SPUTNIK / AFP) / *Editor's note : this image is distributed by Russian state owned agency Sputnik.* (Photo by MIKHAIL METZEL/SPUTNIK/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Biden Builds a Judicial Legacy With Diversified Federal Courts
description: President Joe Biden and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer are transforming the federal courts at a blistering pace and creating an unrivaled legacy of diversity that will redefine the federal bench for a generation.

title: Quebec’s French-First Law Stokes Business Alarm Over Language Cops
description: Businesses in Quebec are looking at all the usual hurdles as they plan for next year: Inflation, supply chains, employee turnover. And then there’s the language police.

title: Spain Unveils €10 Billion Package of Anti-Inflation Measures
description: The Spanish government announced a fresh batch of measures worth €10 billion ($10.6 billion) for 2023 to help ease naggingly-high inflation stoked by the war in Ukraine.

title: China Removes More Covid Travel Restrictions With New Passports, Permits
description: China will start issuing new passports and Hong Kong travel permits to mainland residents as it removes some of the tourism barriers from three years of strict Covid restrictions.

title: Telehealth Firm Lobbies to Keep Prescribing Drugs Amid Scrutiny
description: US officials mull permanent rule change to let online startups write prescriptions for controlled substances

title: Russia Says Ukraine Must Surrender Even as Putin’s Army Retreats
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Ukraine must surrender or face continued war, even as Moscow’s troops have been forced to retreat in a series of damaging defeats.

title: South Africa Passes 200 Days of Power Cuts as 2022 Draws to a Close
description: South Africa passed 200 days of power cuts in 2022 on Tuesday, with more to come.

title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Sees Gain in East; Austria Warns of Blackout
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Ukrainian troops are slowly “erasing” Russia’s advances amid intense fighting in the east.

title: Japan Will Test Travelers From China as Country Reopens Borders
description: Japan will require negative Covid-19 test results for travelers coming from China, which is reopening its borders from Jan. 8 as the country of 1.4 billion abandons its Covid Zero policy at a rapid pace.

title: Whitmer Kidnapping Plot Co-Leader Gets 16 Years in Prison
description: This combo of images provided by the Kent County, Mich., Jail. shows Barry Croft Jr., left, and Adam Fox. Jury selection started Tuesday, Aug. 9, 2022, in the second trial of the two men charged with conspiring to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer in 2020 over their disgust with restrictions early in the COVID-19 pandemic. Prosecutors are putting Adam Fox and Barry Croft Jr. on trial again after a jury in April couldn't reach a verdict. Two co-defendants were acquitted and two more pleaded guilty earlier. (Kent County Sheriff's Office via AP)

title: Taiwan Set to Extend Mandatory Military Service, Report Says
description: Taiwan is set to extend its compulsory military service for men to one year from the current four months, the semi-official Central News Agency reported — a move intended to show Beijing and Washington it is serious about defending itself.

title: Japan’s Kishida Forced to Replace Fourth Minister in Two Months
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s reconstruction minister became the fourth cabinet member to step down since October, as the government seeks to halt a slide in support and push a record budget through parliament.

title: Chinese Public Shows Mixed Emotions About Covid Zero Ending
description: China’s public has mixed emotions about Covid Zero coming to a sudden end, with some people expressing relief and planning their first trips abroad in three years while others worry about the spread of infections.

title: South Korea Ex-President Lee to Be Freed From Prison on Pardon
description: South Korea’s current leader issued a special pardon for former conservative president Lee Myung-bak, who had been serving a 17-year sentence for corruption that could have kept him behind bars into his 90s.

title: Two-Thirds of Junior Doctors Considering Leaving NHS, Poll Finds Ahead of Strike Ballot
description: A poll shows 65% of junior doctors have "actively researched" leaving their jobs in the NHS as the sector prepares for a ballot on industrial action over pay.

title: US Blasts China’s Military Drills Near Taiwan as ‘Provocative’
description: Washington criticized Beijing’s military drills near Taiwan this week as “provocative,” insisting it will continue helping the government in Taipei defend itself.

title: South Korea Sends Drones to Kim Jong Un’s Airspace in Unprecedented Move
description: South Korea sent drones across the border into North Korea for the first time on Monday, an unprecedented tit-for-tat military move after Kim Jong Un’s regime dispatched five unmanned aerial vehicles into its air space.
